page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The 4 x 3 Km block is situated on an upland plateau approximately 600 feet above sea level. It lies to the East of the Clwydian Hills which have recently been designated an area of outstanding natural beauty. The district is completely unspoilt and there has been very little change or development in the area for the past century or more. It consists mainly of scattered farms and houses and some small blocks of woodland. The farms are served by a network of minor roads and the busy A55 trunk road runs East West along the Southern quarter of the block There is a splendid variety of flora and fauna along the lane verges, some of which are extinct in other parts of Great Britain. Hawks, Owls and Kestrels are present along with a wide range of other birds.
